intro: Hymenolepis brachystachys, commonly known as the small-stemmed bladder wort, is a aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, still waters and has delicate, branching stems. Its leaves are usually reduced or scale-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Hymenolepis brachystachys plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to nutrient cycling.
